reqs:
In 2015W, CDST 350B, section 101 is cross-listed with HIST 324, 101. The topic is Inventing Canada, 1840-1896: an examination of political, cultural and national developments within the British North American colonies in the second half of the nineteenth century.
Please note this course will be taught in English.
description: An interdisciplinary introduction to Canadian studies. Required of all Canadian Studies Majors.
